definition: communal meal/formal dinner of club or group
to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize

sentences.english: This is because many family-friendly restaurants have kid-size meals.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲許多提供家庭聚餐的餐館有兒童餐。

sentences.english: Make it an event - a time to share news and tell stories.
sentences.chinese: 可以將聚餐弄成一種分享新鮮事和講故事活動。

sentences.english: We attended a dinner party hosted by the president of the company.
sentences.chinese: 我們參加了由公司總裁舉行的聚餐會。

sentences.english: We have one family meal or outing a week.
sentences.chinese: 每週我們會有一次家庭聚餐或郊遊。

sentences.english: Could you recommend a good place to eat out with friends?
sentences.chinese: 你能推薦一個跟朋友外出聚餐的好地方嗎？

sentences.english: We're wined and dined all week.
sentences.chinese: 我們一個星期都在喝酒聚餐。

sentences.english: The dinner party last night was an AB treat, so the ladies didn't spend much.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚的聚餐是AB制的，所以女士們都沒有花太多錢。

sentences.english: And families sit down to Sunday dinner, and students prepare for school.
sentences.chinese: 美國家庭還會在週日晚上聚餐，學生們仍然照常上課。

sentences.english: The girls and boys who were having a tailgate party asked to dance with us.
sentences.chinese: 戶外聚餐的那幫男女要和我們一起跳舞。

sentences.english: Throughout Cloverleaf's history of twenty-three years, we have had potlucks.
sentences.chinese: 整個立體式二十三年的歷史，我們有聚餐。

sentences.english: Some meals may include appetizers, soup or salad before the main course.
sentences.chinese: 在主菜之前，有些聚餐會上開胃菜，湯品或者沙拉。

sentences.english: Family togetherness is also an important aspect of the trend.
sentences.chinese: 家庭聚餐亦是這一趨勢的重要方面。

sentences.english: He was invited to attend a barbecue social last Saturday afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 上星期六下午他應邀去參加一個烤肉聚餐會。

sentences.english: Because July is a  summer month, the weather is perfect for cooking and eating outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 因爲7月是夏天，氣候非常適合在戶外野炊和聚餐。

sentences.english: The old-fashioned holiday reunions are characterized by karaoke, a group dinner and some shopping.
sentences.chinese: 守舊的節日聚會往往被描述成K歌，聚餐以及購物。

definition: to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
(of a family) to come together at lunar New Year's Eve/family reunion at New Year's
team building (abbr. for 團隊建設|团队建设[tuan2 dui4 jian4 she4])/building camaraderie within the Chinese Communist Youth League 中國共產主義青年團|中国共产主义青年团[Zhong1 guo2 Gong4 chan3 zhu3 yi4 Qing1 nian2 tuan2]
(loanword) party (social gathering)/(Tw) party (typically associated with sex and drugs)
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
